title: EastEnders spoilers: Kathy goes to extreme lengths to test Rainie as Stuart threatens her
text:
Kathy Beale (Gillian Taylforth) is facing quite the dilemma in EastEnders, as she struggles over what to do for the best in regards to helping Rainie Branning (Tanya Franks). However, she came to a decision in tonight’s episode, as she tested how much Rainie wants to be a part of Abi’s life by putting some drugs in her possession.

Earlier this week, Kathy took pity on Rainie and gave her an opportunity to prove herself by offering her a trial shift in the cafe. However, things didn’t go as planned, and she later found Rainie on the floor of her flat with a bottle of vodka in her hand. In tonight’s episode, she quizzed Callum (Tony Clay) about how Rainie had been coping, but when Stuart (Ricky Champ) got wind of Kathy’s interference, he wasn’t best pleased.

He later confronted Kathy in the cafe and accused her of putting Rainie’s recovery at risk by snooping. As a result, he threatened to stop her from seeing Abi if she didn’t back off.

Advertisement

Advertisement

However, Kathy refused to let Stuart intimidate her, and thus she stopped by Max’s (Jake Wood) once more to discuss what had happened. As they talked about Rainie’s drug habit, Max made it clear that — as long as she’s addicted to drugs — she will continue to put her habit above everything else. As a result of this conversation, Kathy came up with an idea to test that theory.

Kathy stopped by Callum’s flat once more to pay Rainie a visit, and proceeded to inform her how she wants nothing more than for her to be a part of Abi’s life.

Rainie was taken aback, and promised that Kathy can trust her. However, Kathy decided to test Rainie, and thus removed a packet of drugs from her bag and left them nearby Rainie — thus prompting her to make a choice.

The options are: the drugs or remaining in Abi’s life.

Which will Rainie choose?

Either way, it’s safe to assume Stuart won’t be too pleased if he hears what Kathy’s done!

EastEnders continues on Friday 11th October at 8pm on BBC One.
